articles.title: Shaking Up Seismology: Geometry as the Groundbreaking Predictor of Earthquakes - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Brown University researchers found that fault geometry, including misalignments and complex structures within fault zones, plays a crucial role in determining earthquake likelihood and strength. This finding, based on studies of California's fault lines, chal…
articles.content: Researchers at Brown University have discovered that the geometry of fault networks, rather than just the friction at fault lines, significantly influences earthquake occurrence and intensity. Credit… [+6752 chars]
